subject: Leadership
title: Cesar Chavez and Labor Leadership
description: A fast breakdown of Cesar Chavez and Labor Leadership for builders.

hook.text: Farm workers had no rights, no voice, no power. Chavez organized them into a movement that changed American labor.

buildup.text: Chavez combined Gandhian nonviolence with community organizing. Boycotts, marches, and fasting became his tools.

discovery.text: The grape boycott succeeded because it connected farm workers' pain to consumers' tables. Everyone had a role to play.

twist.text: Chavez's later leadership became more autocratic. Initial success sometimes breeds the control that undermines it.

climax.text: Movement leaders must evolve with the movement. The skills that start a revolution aren't the skills that sustain it.

punchline.text: Si se puede. Yes, it can be done. But leaders must grow or the movement stalls.

quiz.question: What lesson does Chavez's later leadership illustrate?
options: Leaders must evolve with the movement or risk undermining it
